Brief for newcomers|Study in Australia today

The 2016 Mercer Worldwide cost of living survey rated Sydney and Melbourne as Australia‘s most expensive cities, with Sydney 42nd and Melbourne 71st on the worldwide list, a dramatic drop in rank due to the reduction of the Australian  dollar the U.S. dollar

 

How to get Student Visa |Study in Australia today

  • Apply to any school in Australia and obtain a CoE
  • Create an account with the Australian immigration authorities
  • Make sure you have all the necessary documents in digital format
  • Complete the visa application online
  • Pay the visa and get a TRN-number
  • Possible health checkup and interview.

 

Documents Required Applying for Australian citizenship

To apply for citizenship, you will need the following documents:

  • Full birth certificate showing parent’s details.
  • Passport or travel document.
  • Evidence of change of name if valid.
  • A passport-sized photograph.
  • An identity affirmation signed by an Australian citizen with the correct authority.

Academic Qualified Requirements

Students with EU/EEA school leaving certificates should have the following;

  • Proof of nationality photography of your identification)
  • A secondary school leaving certificate that entitles you to admission to university studies in your home country.
  • German language aptitude test confirming German lessons of at least 4 years.

Visa Cost for students| Study in Australia today

             Students   Visa subclass Note Base application charge
subclass 500 6a 6b 6d AUD630
 subclass 500 (subsequent entrant) 6e AUD630
Student visa subclass 500 – Foreign Affairs or Defence sector nil
Student visa (subclass 500) – Postgraduate research sector AUD630

 

Requirements for Visa| Study in Australia today

Apply for a visa depends on your course. Below are some typical necessities

  • obtain an electronic confirmation of Enrolment (eCOE) certificate
  • Meet the Genuine Temporary Entrant requirement.
  • Verify you have enough finances for airfares, course fees, and living costs
  • Demonstrate English language proficiency
  • Meet health and character requirements
  • Provide evidence of overseas student health cover.

 

Study cost in Australia| Study in Australia today

Education program   Average tuition costs ($AUD)
Foundation courses   $15,000 to $39,000 in total
Undergraduate bachelor degrees   $15,000 to $33,000 per year
Postgraduate masters degree   $20,000 to $37,000  once a year
Doctoral degree   $14,000 to $37,000 per year

 

Top 9 courses to get a job in Australia

  • Information Technology
  • Agriculture, Environmental and Related studies
  • Management and Commerce
  • Architecture and Building
  • Engineering and Related technologies

List of most in-demand jobs in Australia

They are as follows:

  • Stockroom worker. National average earnings: $55,810 per year.
  • Motor mechanic.
  • Early childhood teacher.
  • National standard salary: $59,742 per year.

Jobs with high pay for Australians| Study in Australia today

  • Anesthetists: $192,816
  • Finance Director: an average of $166,086
  • General surgeon
  • Director of operations
  • Python developer
  • Senior information technology project manager
  • Chief Executive officer

List of the lowest paying jobs

  • Retail assistants -$48,200
  • Administrative assistants – $48,793.
  • Factory workers – $48,196
  • Receptionist – 46,926.
  • Pick & packer

How to migrate to Australia|Study in Australia today

Migrating to Australia demand a process and step which are listed below:

  • Research your employment options
  • Apply for a visa
  • Prepare to move
  • Arrive and settle in
